annotations.normalized_text: Lower Saxon Wadden Sea National Park

data.text: The ‘East Frisian Islands’ are popular vacation destinations and part of the ‘Lower Saxon Wadden Sea National Park’. #TravelTuesday
‘Altes Land’ is famous for apples, cherries and the old villages called ‘Marschhufendörfer’. #TravelTuesday
The world’s most kissed girl is Göttingen’s ‘Gänseliesel’. Students have to kiss the statue after doctoral graduation. #TravelTuesday
#TheCondorGuide Germany: The sea in the north, the Harz in the East – welcome to Niedersachsen. #TravelTuesday http://t.co/Rz4P61L0ud

data.text: Thanks, David! @ARdpb @trimet Just FYI - this one does not have a Business Class... HA :)
Hiddensee is a car-free island in the Baltic Sea. The iconic ‘Dornbusch Lighthouse’ was built in 1887 and is open to public. #TravelTuesday
‘Rügen’ is Germany’s largest island and popular for its white chalk cliffs in ‘Jasmund National Park’. #TravelTuesday
The Mecklenburg Lake District is called ‘the land of a thousand seas’ and was already settled around 10,000 B.C. #TravelTuesday
#TheCondorGuide Germany: Three national parks and hundreds of lakes – that’s Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. #TravelTuesday http://t.co/3fQ22IJyMi

The ‘Chiemsee’ is called the Bavarian Sea. On one of its islands Ludwig II built a replica of Versailles – Herrenchiemsee. #TravelTuesday
Bamberg is popular for its breweries. A specialty of the town in Upper Franconia is the smoked ‘Rauchbier’. #TravelTuesday
Disneyland’s Sleeping Beauty Castle is based on the 19th century ‘Neuschwanstein Castle’, built by Ludwig II of Bavaria. #TravelTuesday

Built by Charlemagne in 796 the Aachen Cathedral is the oldest cathedral in northern Europe. #TravelTuesday
The Wuppertal Suspension Railway is famous for Tuffi. The elephant jumped out of it in 1950 and landed safely in the Wupper. #TravelTuesday
‘Zeche Zollverein’ was a coal mine industrial complex from 1851 to 1986. In summer there’s an outdoor swimming pool. #TravelTuesday
